text: Thank you for your help! Agree that there should be a simple way to maintain the icons. Well maybe in the future.

Trey [10:12 AM]
i've created a lot of custom modules in a HubSpot portal, and i have 2 other separate HubSpot portals that I would like to share the custom "framework" that I've created.  is there a way to do this without having to click on every custom module 1 by 1 and choosing "copy portal"?  do i have to write a custom solution using API endpoints?
You can select multiples at a time anc share all or share an entire folder

Hey all I'm Tyler, a Developer in RI working a video module pop-up for a landing page.  Basically when a user clicks on a `<div>` it creates a video overlay that shows a youtube video in the middle of the page that I'd like to add a dark see-through overlay in the background.  I have the video working as intended however the dark overlay is only showing at the top of the page instead of covering the entire DOM, any suggestions?

HI <@ULH765N65> I've done this before with a div that is 100% vh and vw, fixed position, and then overflow:hidden on the body to prevent scrolling. Takes a bit to get the z-indexes right, but that's the path I've taken
oh nice thanks Doug, I'll try playing around with vh and vw, at the moment i just have `width: 100%;` and `height: 100%`

I posted this question in the design-manager thread as well. I need video to play in a modal popup using video uploaded to the HubSpot File Manager. Do I have to custom code a video lightbox or does HubSpot have a module for this common user functionality? I see that <@ULH765N65> is working on something that plays a youtube video, and it looks like he is coding from scratch. Yikes. A ~video~ lightbox is so common that it seems there should be a HubSpot module for that already, right?
I built this a while back. Feel free to use
